Question

What are the disparities within early childhood, education, and income, across race and sex in United States?

We looked at 4 different groups of people in America: black men, black women, white men, and white women. Using My Brotherâ€™s Keeper dataset, we captured a snapshot of the lives of people in each category.

Household Environments

If you chose 25 kids at random from each of the four categories, here's what their household environments would probably look like.

K-12 Education

Here's how students from each category are performing in school, on average. In both the graphs, the gray line depicts the average student's performance.

Income

Here's how much money young adults from these groups are likely to make with just a high-school education.

Made by Po Bhattacharyya, Selin Insel and Viba Subramaniam for Interaction Data Science Course at CMU in Spring 2018.
